alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 5:37AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Warren, Mercer, northeastern Henderson, Rock Island, southwestern Henry, south central Scott, southeastern Muscatine and east central Louisa Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 537 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Buffalo to near Fruitland. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Muscatine, Aledo, Cambridge, Milan, Coal Valley, Burgess, Orion, Blue Grass, Buffalo, Andalusia, Viola, Millersburg, Matherville, New Boston, Alpha, Sherrard and Keithsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 4 and 7, and between mile markers 17 and 30. Interstate 280 between mile markers 4 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren
